description: (a) Understand the CPU's role in a computer.
(b) Understand what is meant by a microprocessor.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: The CPU processes instructions and data. A microprocessor is an integrated circuit on a single chip.

description: (a) Understand the purpose of CPU components in a Von Neumann architecture.
(b) Describe the fetch-decode-execute (FDE) cycle, including each component's role.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Covers ALU, CU, registers (PC, MAR, MDR, CIR, ACC), buses (address, data, control). Details how data/instructions are fetched from RAM, processed, stored in registers, and executed using buses and units.

learning_objectives.description: Understand core, cache, and clock in a CPU and their effect on performance.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: CPU performance depends on number of cores, cache size, and clock speed.

learning_objectives.description: Understand the purpose and use of a CPU instruction set.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: An instruction set lists all machine code commands a CPU can process.

learning_objectives.description: Describe embedded systems, their characteristics, and devices in which they are used.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: Embedded systems perform dedicated functions (e.g., appliances, cars, security, vending). They differ from general-purpose computers (e.g., PCs, laptops).
